nodes.text: Plo Koon's Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor

Unlike many other Jedi in 19 BBY, Plo Koon reverted to flying a standard Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor. This starfighter had a customized paint job similar to that of Plo's Blade of Dorin and Anakin Skywalker's Azure Angel, marking the ship with distinctive blue and white stripes.

A Jedi Master with a long, distinguished record of service, Plo Koon, from his seat on the Jedi High Council, helped see the Jedi Order through many trials in its twilight years. His tendency to see things in the stark terms of simple right and wrong served him well over the years. Joined with his heightened extrasensory abilities, it lent him a clarity of vision superior to some of the other Jedi. This clarity extended to his piloting; he was a straightforward warrior who was often seen at the head of a bombing run or diving charge. He was, however, unprepared for the subtlety of the Sith, and was blown out of the sky of Cato Neimoidia by his clone wingman, Captain Jag, after the issuance of Order 66.

Earlier during the Clone Wars, Plo Koon was gifted a Delta-7B that was named the Blade of Dorin. This ship was marked with the same color scheme and design as Skywalker's Azure Angel. It is unknown why he switched from the Blade of Dorin to a standard Delta-7 starfighter.
